{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3483585,"name":"ahuang","username":"ahuang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T18:47:29.441Z","cooked":"

We just updated robotpy to 2025 version using py -m pip install --upgrade robotpy
When we try to use: py -m robotpy sync command we get 'robotpy’ is a package and cannot be directly executed.

We have tried py -m pip uninstall “robotpy[all]” and then py -m pip install --upgrade “robotpy[all]” with no luck.

This is the link I have tried to follow: .main; “robotpy” is a package and cannot be directly executed

How do I resolve this error?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T18:47:29.441Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":91,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":475.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481920,"topic_slug":"robotpy-is-a-package-and-cannot-be-directly-executed","display_username":"ahuang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/main-robotpy-is-a-package-and-cannot-be-directly-executed/452326","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":".__main__; 'robotpy' is a package and cannot be directly executed","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-is-a-package-and-cannot-be-directly-executed/481920/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3483695,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T20:08:13.383Z","cooked":"

I don’t think you can —upgrade all for packages you just uninstalled. Theoretically, if you reinstall everything now you should have the most up to date versions of everything right?

What version of Python do you have installed, and what is the output of py -m pip list?

Also, if you have a directory (edit: or file) named ‘robotpy’ in your robot code, then you’ll get this error. If this is the case, rename that directory to anything else.

It needs to be ‘robot.py’

To get the version of python, you can run py --version.

It sounds like you have some kind of environmental conflict – do you have multiple versions of python installed? Try running these commands:

mkdir foo
cd foo
py -m robotpy --help

Running the robotpy command from an empty directory should resolve the issue.

If that doesn’t work, check python -m pip list to ensure that robotpy-cli is installed.

Another way you could test is to find the python scripts directory, and run robotpy.exe directly.

We uninstalled and then reinstalled robotpy-cli and now it works!

RobotPy","slug":"tests-are-not-running-in-robotpy","posts_count":7,"reply_count":5,"highest_post_number":7,"image_url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/3X/6/e/6e623a5c0e49316b4cbe9992c7e342e0b9cff78b_2_1024x418.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T18:10:45.375Z","last_posted_at":"2025-03-07T05:09:08.984Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-03-07T05:09:08.984Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"I
